Posts.Content: Sep 10, 2013 07:27AM snoopy66 wrote: Momof3, thanks!  And yes, standard process for my doc, post op appointment to discuss biopsy results (whatever they may be) on Friday afternoon....
Posts.Title: Stereotactic Needle Biopsy MomOf3AwesomeKids MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2013 12:08PM snoopy66 wrote: Momof3, I suspect they will advise to return in 6 months for a mammography if the biopsy is benign, but I did not ask my surgeon specifically.  I am NOT a patient person, so if (fingers crossed) my biopsy is benign I will probably beg for another scan in 6 months, for piece of mind! I'll let you know what my doc says after my biopsy and post op.  Wow, I am just so thankful for this site and to be able to ask questions and interact with everyone as we wait.  I have two kids, my husband and I decided not to share anything until we know exactly what the deal is.  It's so hard though, very close to them (both teenagers, one in college many hours out of state), they can read me like a book, so trying to hide my worry and mood swings is actually the hardest part right now!
Posts.Title: Stereotactic Needle Biopsy MomOf3AwesomeKids MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2013 06:38PM snoopy66 wrote: Momof3, I am so sorry to hear your doc did not call you with more information, ugh :(  I was fortunate that the imaging center had the radiologist speak to me right there to show what they saw and provide her feedback and guidance to proceed to see a breast surgeon and advise a biopsy would most likely be recommended, as no additional images could clarify status of my microcalcifcations.  I, of course, did some snooping around on the medical websites for general info about biospy types etc.  Today the surgeon just confirmed a biopsy is the only way to know if benign or not.  My thoughts and prayers are with you that your results will be in this week and the news will be good!!  Right now I guess we both just need to take deep breaths and think positive.  Hope you are feeling well after your procedure.  Take good care.
Posts.Title: Stereotactic Needle Biopsy MomOf3AwesomeKids MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Sep 9, 2013 05:25PM snoopy66 wrote: Lovemy2Kids, did you schedule a biopsy yet?  Waiting is so hard, I know, hang in there.  I had to wait two weeks but finally had my biopsy this morning.  I am sore, but relieved the procedure is behind me....I just want to know at this point, but now more waiting, until late Friday. Here to listen/read anytime.  Know there are so many ladies who have been in a place similar to yours, so this is the place to think out loud, ask questions or just vent.  Praying for good results for us both!!
Posts.Title: Stereotactic Needle Biopsy MomOf3AwesomeKids MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2013 04:01PM snoopy66 wrote: Annette, thank you.

Posts.Content: Aug 28, 2013 04:37PM snoopy66 wrote: Mom of 3, glad to hear all went well with the procedure.  Prayers all will be well!  :)   How long do you have to wait for the results?  Keep us posted.  I am just back from a visit to the surgeon myself, I am having a Sterotactic done on 9/9 for microcalcifications of right breast.  Not nervous about procedure, but about the results (will have on Friday the 13th UGH).  I have not seen the fully written up reports with terminology, but I have seen the physical mammograms with the calcifications. The surgeon described the area of concern to be smaller than a finger tip.  Should I have asked for the write up?  I do trust the surgeon, she only does breast surgery and comes highly regarded. No family history or personal history. The waiting is difficult for sure.
Posts.Title: Stereotactic Needle Biopsy MomOf3AwesomeKids MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Aug 29, 2013 08:53AM snoopy66 wrote: angelmom, that is wonderful news!  So happy for you, I can only imagine your relief.    I hope Momof3 gets the same news, and then me too!  I did see the mammo with my microcalfications and it appeared there were quite a few as well, but in a small space (~1cm).  It's great they called you right away with the news so you didn't continue to worry.  Did they tell you to come back in 6 months?  I was wondering if they will do that no matter what the biopsy says....
Posts.Title: Stereotactic Needle Biopsy MomOf3AwesomeKids MelissaDallas

Posts.Content: Sep 12, 2013 01:16PM snoopy66 wrote: Biopsy results were negative!!!!!!!!!!!  Doc's office just called, BS will call me later to discuss any follow-up (assume 6 month mammo?), just didn't want me to worry any longer so called to confirm negative results, thank God, I can breathe!    What a whirlwind few weeks. I could not have made it through without the people on this site, the prayers, guidance, support and strength everyone who posts here possesses is just amazing.  I plan to continue to visit to offer any help I can to those who will experience similar tests, waiting and worrying.
